Wisdom: أَكْبَرُ الْعَيْبِ أَنْ تَعِيبَ غَيْرَكَ بِمَا هُوَ فِيكَ
enWisdom: The greatest flaw is that you fault others for what is [also] in you

Wisdom: إِنَّ أَنْصَحَ النَّاسِ أَنْصَحُهُمْ لِنَفْسِهِ وَأَطْوَعُهُمْ لِرَبِّهِ
enWisdom: Verily the most sincere of people is one who admonishes himself and is most submissive to his Lord

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْوَعْظَ الَّذِي لَا يَمَجُّهُ سَمْعٌ وَلَا يَعْدِلُهُ نَفْعٌ مَا سَكَتَ عَنْهُ لِسَانُ الْقَوْلِ وَنَطَقَ بِهِ لِسَانُ الْفِعْلِ
enWisdom: Verily the admonition that is neither discarded by the ears nor matched in benefit is that which is not expressed by the speaking tongue, rather it is exhibited by the tongue of action
At times one who is not a sincere adviser may give good advice
He who seeks advice from his enemies is indeed ignorant

Wisdom: كَيْفَ يَنْصَحُ غَيْرَهُ مَنْ يَغُشُّ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: How can one who deceives himself give sincere advice to others?

Wisdom: مَنْ نَصَحَ نَفْسَهُ كَانَ جَدِيراً بِنُصْحِ غَيْرِهِ
enWisdom: One who advises [and admonishes] himself is worthy of giving advice to others

Wisdom: مَا أَغَشَّ نَفْسَهُ مَنْ يَنْصَحُ غَيْرَهُ
enWisdom: One who sincerely advises others does not deceive himself
Your advice [when given] in front of other people is [considered] a rebuke

Wisdom: لَا تُقَاوِلَنَّ إِلَّا مُنْصِفاً وَلَا تُرْشِدَنَّ إِلَّا مُسْتَرْشِداً
enWisdom: Never debate except with one who is fair and never guide anyone but the seeker of guidance

Wisdom: لَا يَنْصَحُ اللَّئِيمُ أَحَداً إِلَّا عَنْ رَغْبَةٍ أَوْ رَهْبَةٍ فَإِذَا زَالَتِ الرَّغْبَةُ وَالرَّهْبَةُ عَادَ إِلَى جَوْهَرِهِ
enWisdom: The wicked one does not sincerely advise anyone except out of desire or fear, so when the desire or fear disappears, he returns to his true nature

Wisdom: يُسْتَدَلُّ عَلَى الْمُحْسِنِينَ بِمَا يَجْرِي لَهُمْ عَلَى أَلْسُنِ الْأَخْيَارِ وَحُسْنِ الْأَفْعَالِ وَجَمِيلِ السِّيرَةِ
enWisdom: The good doers are recognized by what the righteous people speak about them, and by their good deeds and virtuous conduct
